title: Admin login redirect to admin panel + fix Agrigence social media links

requirements.text: Enable admins to sign in from the same login entry point as regular users and automatically open the admin interface when the signed-in identity is an admin. Specifically: after a successful Internet Identity login, check admin status via the existing admin check and redirect admins to "/admin"; redirect non-admin authenticated users to "/dashboard".

quotes: also admin can login where from user login but when admin login the admin iterface will open where admin can use full control of app

acceptanceCriteria: From the /login page, clicking the Internet Identity button completes Internet Identity authentication and then automatically routes an admin identity to /admin.
From the /login page, clicking the Internet Identity button completes Internet Identity authentication and then automatically routes a non-admin identity to /dashboard.
If the admin check fails (network/canister error), the UI shows an English error message and does not incorrectly route the user to /admin.
The existing /admin page continues to enforce access control (non-admins see the access denied screen).

requirements.text:
Replace the placeholder social media links in the site footer with working, correct URLs for Agrigence profiles using the provided handles, and open them in a new tab with safe link attributes. Use these URLs:
- LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/agrigence
- Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/agrigence.in
- Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/agrigence.in
- X: https://x.com/agrigence
- YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/@agrigence

acceptanceCriteria: Footer social icons are no longer "#" and each icon navigates to the correct Agrigence social URL listed in this requirement.
Each social link uses target="_blank" and rel="noopener noreferrer".
All user-facing text remains in English.

constraints: Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui (read-only shadcn components).
Do not edit frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts or frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts (immutable paths).
Backend must remain a single Motoko actor in backend/main.mo; only add migration logic if a state upgrade is required.
nonGoals: Implementing email/password authentication (the current email/password form is a placeholder and is out of scope for this request).
Adding or integrating third-party authentication providers beyond Internet Identity.
Changing admin permissions/role definitions in the backend beyond what is required for redirect behavior.
